    Utility methods used to manipulate expressions.

    • Method Detail

      • evaluateStringValueAsExpression

        public static String evaluateStringValueAsExpression(String value)
        Detects if a string value happens to be an expression of type string, and if so, evaluates that expression. Sample use cases:

        Value Result Comments
        abc abc The value is not an expression
        "abc" abc The value is an expression of type string (a string literal)
        1 + 2 1 + 2 The value is an expression of type integer and is therefore not evaluated.
        1 + "2" 12 The value is an expression of type string and is therefore evaluated.
        ${system:myProperty}
        • If system property "myProperty" is defined: the value of that system property
        • IllegalArgumentException otherwise
        		The value is an expression of type string and is therefore evaluated.
        ${env:myEnvVariable}
        • If environment variable "myEnvVariable" is defined: the value of that environment variable
        • IllegalArgumentException otherwise
        		The value is an expression of type string and is therefore evaluated.
        $100 IllegalArgumentException The value is an expression of type string that contains a reference to a message field, which is not supported.
        Parameters:
        value - A string configuration value.
        Returns:
        The original value if it does not happen to be an expression, or the result of evaluating the expression otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If any of the following occurs:
        • The value happens to be an expression and an exception occurs when evaluating that expression. This can be the case typically for expressions of the type ${system:...} or ${env:...} that make use of an invalid reference.
        • The value happens to be an expression and that expression contains message field or variable references.

      • evaluateStringValueAsExpression

        public static String evaluateStringValueAsExpression(String value,
                                                     boolean disableLogging)
        This method behaves in a similar way to evaluateStringValueAsExpression(String), with the additional option to instruct the expressions compiler to refrain from logging when compiling the expression. This allows the evaluation of expressions in contexts where the logging subsystem is not yet available.
        Parameters:
        value - A string configuration value.
        disableLogging - If true, instructs the expressions compiler to refrain from logging when compiling the expression.
        Returns:
        The original value if it does not happen to be an expression, or the result of evaluating the expression otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If any of the following occurs:
        • The value happens to be an expression and an exception occurs when evaluating that expression. This can be the case typically for expressions of the type ${system:...} or ${env:...} that make use of an invalid reference.
        • The value happens to be an expression and that expression contains message field or variable references.
